data.enText: the act or process of moving or the way sth moves
Newton's laws of motion

data.chText: 船身摇摆不定，让我觉得恶心。
data.enText: The swaying motion of the ship was making me feel seasick.

data.chText: 列车未停稳时不要下车。
data.enText: Do not alight while the train is still in motion (= moving) .
Rub the cream in with a circular motion.

data.chText: （为传递信息用手或头做的）动作
data.enText: a particular movement made usually with your hand or your head, especially to communicate sth

data.chText: 他手一挥，屋子里便安静了下来。
data.enText: At a single motion of his hand, the room fell silent.
a formal proposal that is discussed and voted on at a meeting
to table/put forward a motion
to propose a motion (= to be the main speaker in favour of a motion)

data.chText: 这项提议以六比一的票数通过。
data.enText: The motion was adopted/carried by six votes to one.
an act of emptying the bowels ; the waste matter that is emptied from the bowels
go through the motions (of doing sth)
to do or say sth because you have to, not because you really want to
set/put sth in motion
to start sth moving
They set the machinery in motion.

data.chText: 变革的车轮已经开始运转。
data.enText: The wheels of change have been set in motion.
to make a movement, usually with your hand or head to show sb what you want them to do
I motioned to the waiter.
He motioned for us to follow him.

data.chText: 她示意他到她办公室来。
data.enText: She motioned him into her office.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

simple_means.memory_skill: mot 动 + ion 动作或状态 → 运动

means: (为传递信息用手或头做的)动作

ex.enText: the rocking motion of the boat

ex.chText: 这些数据是根据行星的运行而计算得出的。
ex.enText: These data are calculated based on the motion of the planets.

ex.chText: 你对永动机有什么看法？
ex.enText: What is your opinion on the perpetual motion machine?

synonyms.bx: 指某人或某物运动的过程或方式。

ex.chText: 看到信号之后，她没有再朝门口移动。
ex.enText: Seeing the signal, she made no move towards the door.

ex.chText: 桌子上的那台摄影机将会记录你的一举一动。
ex.enText: The camera on the table will record your every move.

synonyms.bx: 指朝某一方向的移动，通常用单数。

ex.chText: 观众为舞蹈演员优美的动作喝彩。
ex.enText: The audience applauded the dancer's graceful movements.

ex.chText: 窗帘稍微动了一下，暴露了他藏身的位置。
ex.enText: A slight movement of the curtains showed where he was hiding.

synonyms.bx: 多指某人或某物位置的变化。

data.enText: go through the motions (of doing sth)
to do or say sth because you have to, not because you really want to
set/put sth in motion
to start sth moving
They set the machinery in motion.

data.chText: 变革的车轮已经开始运转。
data.enText: The wheels of change have been set in motion.

tr: the act of changing location from one place to another
example: police controlled the motion of the crowd
the movement of people from the farms to the cities
his move put him directly in my path

tr: a change of position that does not entail a change of location
example: the reflex motion of his eyebrows revealed his surprise
movement is a sign of life
an impatient move of his hand

tr: the use of movements (especially of the hands) to communicate familiar or prearranged signals
a formal proposal for action made to a deliberative assembly for discussion and vote
example: he made a motion to adjourn

tr: a natural event that involves a change in the position or location of something
an optical illusion of motion produced by viewing a rapid succession of still pictures of a moving object
example: the cinema relies on apparent motion
the succession of flashing lights gave an illusion of movement
they were in a state of steady motion

tr: show, express or direct through movement
example: He gestured his desire to leave

value.def: Motion is the activity or process of continually changing position or moving from one place to another.

example.ex: ...the laws governing light, sound, and motion...
example.tran: 有关声、光和运动的定律

example.ex: One group of muscles sets the next group in motion...
example.tran: 一组肌肉带动下一组肌肉运动。

example.ex: The wind from the car's motion whipped her hair around her head.
example.tran: 汽车驶过带起的风吹乱了她的头发。

value.def: A motion is an action, gesture, or movement.

example.ex: Cover each part of the body with long sweeping strokes or circular motions...
example.tran: 对全身每个部位画长弧线轻抚或做圆圈状按摩。

example.ex: He made a neat chopping motion with his hand.
example.tran: 他挥手做了一个干净利落的劈砍的动作。

value.def: A motion is a formal proposal or statement in a meeting, debate, or trial, which is discussed and then voted on or decided on.

example.ex: The conference is now debating the motion and will vote on it shortly...
example.tran: 大会正在就提议进行辩论，稍后将就此表决。

example.ex: Opposition parties are likely to bring a no-confidence motion against the government...
example.tran: 反对党很可能提出对政府的不信任案。

example.ex: He is eligible now to file a motion for a new trial.
example.tran: 他现在有资格提议重新进行审判。

value.tran: (会议、辩论或审判时提出的)动议，提议，议案

value.def: If you motion to someone, you move your hand or head as a way of telling them to do something or telling them where to go.

example.ex: She motioned for the locked front doors to be opened...
example.tran: 她示意把锁着的前门打开。

example.ex: He stood aside and motioned Don to the door...
example.tran: 他站到一边并示意唐到门口去。

example.ex: I motioned him to join us...
example.tran: 我示意他加入到我们的队伍中来。

example.ex: He motioned to her to go behind the screen.
example.tran: 他示意她走到屏风后面。

value.def: Some people, especially doctors or nurses, use motion as a polite way of referring to a person's act of defecation or the faeces produced.

example.ex: Try to make sure your bowel motions are regular and that you avoid any constipation.
example.tran: 尽量保证大便规律，避免便秘。

value.tran: (尤为医生、护士用语)排便，大便

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 movement

value.def: If you say that someone is going through the motions, you think they are only saying or doing something because it is expected of them without being interested, enthusiastic, or sympathetic.

example.ex: 'You really don't care, do you?' she said quietly. 'You're just going through the motions.'
example.tran: “你其实不在意，对不对？”她悄声说，“你就是装装样子而已。”

value.def: If you go through the motions, you pretend to do something by making the movements associated with a particular action.

example.ex: The sailor went through all the motions smartly...
example.tran: 这个水手机灵地走了走过场。

example.ex: Actors go through the motions of different types of labor.
example.tran: 演员们假装从事不同的劳动。

value.def: If a process or event is in motion, it is happening. If it is set in motion, it is happening or beginning to happen.

example.ex: His job as England manager begins in earnest now his World Cup campaign is in motion...
example.tran: 现在世界杯足球赛的征战工作已经展开，而他作为英格兰队主教练的工作也真正开始了。

example.ex: Her sharp, aggressive tone set in motion the events that led to her downfall.
example.tran: 她那咄咄逼人的尖锐语调拉开了导致她垮台的事件的序幕。

gramarinfo.label: usu v-link PHR, PHR after v

value.tran: 正在发生;在进行中;即将发生

value.def: If someone sets the wheels in motion, they take the necessary action to make something start happening.

example.ex: I have set the wheels in motion to sell Endsleigh Court.
example.tran: 我已着手出售恩德斯勒公馆。

trans: 在开动中，在运转中，处于兴奋【骚动】状态
控制型；动作控制；動作控制；移动控制；运动控制器
相对运动；相對運動；相对移动；交会；相对的运动
运动方程；方程式；运动方程式
运动补偿；动态补偿；移动补偿；动作补偿；运动位移补偿
动作分析；运动分析；作分析；动作捕捉系统；动作研究

partsOfSpeech.dec: auto 自己 + mob 动 + ile 属于…的 → 自己动的〔车〕→ 汽车
book 书 + mob 动 + ile 表物体 → 动的书 → 流动图书馆
com 加强 + mot 动 + ion 表动作 → 到处都在动 → 动乱
de 非，相反 + mobilize 动员 → 动员〔退伍〕→ 复员
de 向下 + mot 动 + e → 向下动 → 使降级
e 出 + mot 动 + ion 表名词 → 动出〔感情〕→ 感情
im 不 + mobile 活动的，可动的 → 静止的
loco 地方 + mot 动 + ive 表物 → 从一个地方跑到另一个地方的东西 → 火车头
mobb〔= mob〕动 + ish …的 → 乱动的 → 暴乱的
mob 动 + ster 表人 → 匪徒，歹徒
mob 动 + ile 物体 → 活动的，可动的
mob 动 + ility 性质 →〔人〕动起来 → 能动性
mobil〔e〕活动的，可动的 + ize 使… → 使〔人〕动 → 动员
mot 动 + ion 动作或状态 → 运动
mot 动 + ive 表名词 → 动机
motiv〔e〕动机 + ate 使… → 使有动机 → 推动
pro 向前 + mot 动 + e → 向前运动 → 促进
